override to make it non-abstract contract
this mock file set the user that deploys the contract as maintainer to simplify the test.

activateNonReentrant().details: Accessible only from non quarantined exit games, uses a mutex

addExitQueue(uint256,address).details: The queue is created as a new contract instance

deactivateNonReentrant().details: Accessible only from non quarantined exit games, uses a mutex

enqueue(uint256,address,uint64,(uint64,u.details: emits ExitQueued event, which can be used to back trace the priority inside the queueCaller of this function should add "pragma experimental ABIEncoderV2;" on top of filePriority (exitableAt, txPos, exitId) must be unique per queue. Do not enqueue when the same priority is already in the queue.

params.exitId: ID used by the exit processor contract to determine how to process the exit
params.exitProcessor: The exit processor contract, called during "processExits"
params.exitableAt: The earliest time a specified exit can be processed
params.txPos: Transaction position for the exit priority. For SE it should be the exit tx, for IFE it should be the youngest input tx position.
params.vaultId: Vault ID of the vault that stores exiting funds

enqueue(uint256,address,uint64,(uint64,u.return: A unique priority number computed for the exit

params.outputId: The output ID to flag as spent

params.vaultId: ID of the vault that handles the token

hasExitQueue(uint256,address).return: bool Defines whether the queue for a token was created

isExitGameSafeToUse(address).details: Exposes information about exit games quarantine

params._contract: Address of the exit game contract

isExitGameSafeToUse(address).return: boolean Whether the contract is safe to use and is not under quarantine

params.maxExitsToProcess: Maximum number of exits to process
params.topExitId: Unique identifier for prioritizing the first exit to process. Set to zero to skip this check.
params.vaultId: Vault ID of the vault that stores exiting funds

registerExitGame(uint256,address,uint8).details: Emits ExitGameRegistered event to notify clients

params._contract: Address of the exit game contract
params._protocol: The transaction protocol, either 1 for MVP or 2 for MoreVP
params._txType: The tx type where the exit game wants to register

activateNonReentrant().notice: Activates non reentrancy mode        Guards against reentering into publicly accessible code that modifies state related to exits

addExitQueue(uint256,address).notice: Adds queue to the Plasma framework

batchFlagOutputsFinalized(bytes32[],uint.notice: Batch flags already spent outputs (only not already spent)

enqueue(uint256,address,uint64,(uint64,u.notice: Enqueue exits from exit game contracts is a function that places the exit into the        priority queue to enforce the priority of exit during 'processExits'

exitGameToTxType(address).notice: Public getter for retrieving tx type with exit game address

exitGames(uint256).notice: Public getter for retrieving exit game address with tx type

flagOutputFinalized(bytes32,uint160).notice: Flags a single output as spent if it is not flagged already

getMaintainer().notice: override to make it non-abstract contract this mock file set the user that deploys the contract as maintainer to simplify the test.

hasExitQueue(uint256,address).notice: Checks if the queue for a specified token was created

isAnyInputFinalizedByOtherExit(bytes32[].notice: Checks whether any of the output with the given outputIds is already spent

isExitGameSafeToUse(address).notice: Checks whether the contract is safe to use and is not under quarantine

isOutputFinalized(bytes32).notice: Checks whether output with a given outputId is finalized

processExits(uint256,address,uint160,uin.notice: Processes any exits that have completed the challenge period. Exits are processed according to the exit priority.

protocols(uint256).notice: Public getter for retrieving protocol with tx type

registerExitGame(uint256,address,uint8).notice: Registers an exit game within the PlasmaFramework. Only the maintainer can call the function.
